{{Infobox NFL season | logo = | team = Saskatchewan Roughriders | year = 2009 | record = '''10â7â1''' | division_place = '''1st, West''' | coach = [[Ken Miller (football coach)|Ken Miller]] | general manager = [[Eric Tillman]] | stadium = [[Mosaic Stadium at Taylor Field]] | playoffs = '''Lost in [[97th Grey Cup|Grey Cup]]''' | MOP = [[Darian Durant]] | MOC = [[Rob Bagg]] | MOR = [[Jerrell Freeman]] | uniform = Image:CFL SSK Jersey 2009.png }} The '''[[2009 CFL season|2009]] [[Saskatchewan Roughriders]] season''' was the 52nd season for the team in the [[Canadian Football League]]. The Roughriders attempted to win their 4th [[Grey Cup]] championship but lost to the Alouettes in the [[97th Grey Cup|Grey Cup final]]. The Roughriders finished the season in first place for the first time since 1976 and finished with a 10â7â1 record. ==Off-season== === CFL Draft=== The [[2009 CFL Draft]] took place on May 2, 2009. Due to a series of trades, the Roughriders had only two draft picks. Both were selected from the local [[University of Regina]] Rams team.{{cite news|url=http://www.riderville.com/news/press_releases/3178/|title=RIDERS MAKE THE DAY FOR TWO LOCAL PROSPECTS|last=Blair|first=Mitchell |date=2009-05-02|publisher=Riderville.com|accessdate=2009-05-03}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} {| class="wikitable sortable sortable" border="1" |- !
